waitingMessage.waiting: Waiting :: Hold on :: Just a moment :: One second :: Patience is a virtue :: Almost there :: Loading awesomeness
waitingMessage.fetchingWebResults: Searching the Web :: Browsing the internet :: Looking online :: Scouring the web :: Consulting the oracle :: Asking the internet nicely :: Diving into cyberspace :: Mining the web
waitingMessage.queryingKnowledgeStack: Querying @:knowledgeStack.title :: Searching your knowledge :: Looking through your docs :: Exploring your knowledge base :: Rifling through your wisdom :: Consulting your digital library :: Scanning your archives :: Digging through your notes
waitingMessage.preparingTools: Preparing Tools :: Getting tools ready :: Setting up tools :: Loading tools :: Sharpening the instruments :: Assembling the toolkit :: Warming up the engines :: Prepping the workspace
waitingMessage.connectingToModel: Model is doing its magic âœ¨ :: AI is thinking :: Processing your request :: Working on it :: Crunching the numbers :: Neurons firing :: Pondering deeply :: Computing brilliance :: Engaging brain mode :: Summoning intelligence
waitingMessage.processingContext: Processing Context :: Understanding context :: Analyzing context :: Reading the situation :: Connecting the dots :: Grasping the big picture :: Piecing it together :: Making sense of things
waitingMessage.streaming: Streaming :: Sending response :: Delivering answer :: Transmitting :: Beaming down results :: Flowing your way :: En route to you :: Coming in hot
waitingMessage.scrubbingPIIData: Scrubbing PII Data :: Protecting your privacy :: Removing personal info :: Anonymizing data :: Keeping secrets safe :: Privacy mode engaged :: Redacting the sensitive bits :: Going incognito
waitingMessage.synthesizingQuery: Synthesizing Query for Better Results :: Optimizing your question :: Enhancing query :: Refining search terms :: Polishing your request :: Fine-tuning the question :: Crafting the perfect query :: Making your words shine
waitingMessage.fetchingLiveContexts: Fetching Live Contexts :: Gathering real-time data :: Pulling fresh insights :: Syncing with live sources :: Tapping into the data stream :: Collecting current intel :: Refreshing context feeds :: Harvesting live updates :: Connecting to the pulse

onboard.getStarted: We'd need at least one model provider to get started.

desktop.getStarted: How would you like to get started?

customLocation.title: Got Ollama/Msty Models?
customLocation.description: You can use your existing Ollama or Msty models directly, if any, or specify a custom location. Note: we will still be using our own service to run those models.
customLocation.descriptionMLX: If you don't have any MLX models yet, you can specify a custom location where you'd like to store them.
customLocation.descriptionMLXWithSwama: We found MLX models in your Hugging Face Hub cache! You can use them directly or specify a custom location.
customLocation.notAvailableForMLX: Custom model locations are not available for MLX

setupLocalAI.description: To get you started, {modelName} will be downloaded. You can choose a different model.

pros.item1: Use models like DeepSeek R1, Meta Llama4, Microsoft Phi4, IBM Granite, Google Gemma, etc
pros.item2: Use offline and keep your @:data private
pros.item3: Models are free to download and use

successMessage.detail: You can now start chatting with your models privately and securely.

errorMessage.detail: We could not set up @:localAIService{'.'} Please check the logs for more details. {errorMessage}
errorMessage.epermDetail: There was a permission issue setting up Local AI. You can rerun the app as an admin (not recommended) or consider installing the app as for a single user only (recommended).
errorMessage.abortDetail: {errorMessage} Consider installing Local AI from archive files if you continue to get this error. Please visit https://docs.msty.studio/getting-started/onboarding

errorMessage.detail: We could not set up MLX Service. Please check the logs for more details. {errorMessage}

setupMLX.description: To get you started, {modelName} will be downloaded. MLX is Apple's optimized framework for Apple Silicon.
setupMLX.experimentalInfo: MLX is currently in experimental mode. It may have some limitations and rough edges. Please report any issues to the team.

pros.item1: Optimized for Apple Silicon (M1, M2, M3, M4)
pros.item2: Efficient memory usage with unified memory architecture
pros.item3: Supports MLX, SafeTensors, and GGUF models

cons.item1: Only available on Apple Silicon Macs
cons.item2: Smaller model selection compared to Ollama

successMessage.detail: You can now use MLX models with optimal performance on your Mac.

addRemoteModelsProvider.description: With most online providers, you'd need to get an API key from the provider's website. {findYourKey}

pros.item1: Use OpenAI, Azure, Claude Sonnet, Google Gemini, Perplexity, Remote Ollama, Remote Msty, etc
pros.item3: Some vendors provide extra features like image generation, web search, etc

completedWithProvider.detail: You are now ready to chat with one of the models from {providerName}.

mstyRemoteEndpoint.description: Make sure Msty Desktop is running with remote connections enabled.
mstyRemoteEndpoint.learnMore: Learn how to enable remote connections

mstyLocalEndpoint.description: This service runs whenever the app itself is up and running. You may have to update the port number if Local AI port got changed. Otherwise, it's best to leave it as is.

ollamaRemoteEndpoint.description: When using self-hosted Ollama, make sure Ollama is running and accessible at the provided URL. You must add https://msty.studio to the allowed origins when starting Ollama service.

mlxEndpoint.description: This provider is used to run MLX models on Apple Silicon Macs. Most likely, you won't need to change the default endpoint. If you do, make sure MLX service is running and accessible at the provided URL.

mlxCommunityModels.searchPlaceholderAlt: Find MLX optimized models from HuggingFace. Or get started with one of the model families below.

editDialog.title: Edit Sticky Prompt
editDialog.description: When a 'sticky' prompt is pinned, it is added to the beginning of each new message while ignoring any previous ones. This effectively makes the conversation focused on one active context. System prompt is always included in the context.

contextShield.title: @:context Shield
contextShield.enableContextShieldWithSplitsSync: Enable @:contextShield.title{'.'} Hold Option/Alt to @:contextShield.title all synced splits.
contextShield.removeContextShieldWithSplitsSync: Disable @:contextShield.title{'.'} Hold Option/Alt to remove @:contextShield.title from all synced splits.
contextShield.summaryDescriptionInfoHeader: This summary is generated from the context of the conversations above and is included in the context when generating new messages below this shield.

appVersion.title: App Version
appVersion.description: The latest updates are checked periodically and you will be notified when a new update is available. You can also manually check for updates, which will then automatically install any available updates.

modelsInfo.title: Models Info
modelsInfo.description: Update your local model metadata. This information includes details about each model, but not the model files themselves. This applies to both locally stored and online models.

appSettings.title: App Settings
appSettings.description: Resetting app settings to their defaults can help resolve potential issues. This will restore the default user preferences, such as appearance and models path, but will not delete any data, including chats or downloaded/imported models.

resetConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to reset all app settings to their defaults? This will restore default preferences but won't delete your data.

dataPaths.title: Data Paths
dataPaths.description: All data, including models, conversations, settings, and logs, are stored locally on your device. Only modify the contents of these directories if you are familiar with the application's file structure.

helpAndDiscussions.title: Help & Discussions
helpAndDiscussions.description: Connect with our community on Discord to get support, share your feedback, and stay informed.

logViewer.title: Log Viewer
logViewer.description: View and analyze application logs in real-time. Use filters and search to troubleshoot issues efficiently.

clearPermanentlyConfirmation.message: Are you sure you want to clear the log file? This will permanently delete all log entries.

logViewer.noMatchingLogs: No logs match the current filters

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Review and manage application notifications including errors, warnings, and info events.

clearPermanentlyConfirmation.message: Are you sure you want to permanently delete all notifications? This action cannot be undone.

purge.label: Purge Notifications
purge.confirmMessageDays: Are you sure you want to delete notifications older than {days} days? This action cannot be undone.

dataBackup.title: @:data Backup
dataBackup.description: Manage your data backup settings. You can export your data for backup, clear it, or restore from a backup file.

dataBackupReminderInterval.title: @:data Backup Reminder Interval
dataBackupReminderInterval.description: How often to remind you to backup your data.

dataMigrate.title: Studio Migration

pointsToRemember.activeWorkspace: You can import Prompt Library Prompts, Remote Model Providers, Conversations, and Attachments into the current workspace you are in. If you want to import into a different workspace, please switch to that workspace first.
pointsToRemember.remoteModelProviders: Migrating remote model providers will NOT carry over API keys, they must be re-entered. Some legacy models may not be supported in Studio.
pointsToRemember.attachmentsMigration: If migrating attachments, first zip the attachments folder. You can migrate attachments separately after migrating the database or together with the database.

databaseMigration.title: Database Migration

attachmentsMigration.title: Attachments Migration

attachmentsMigration.action: Drag and drop your zipped attachments folder

missingDataWarning.description: Please select a database file and at least one table to migrate
missingDataWarning.title: Missing Data

dataMigrate.description: Migrate your data from Msty App 1.x into Studio. Imported data will not overwrite existing data.

rtlSupport.title: RTL Support
rtlSupport.description: Enable right-to-left text direction for languages like Arabic, Hebrew, and Persian

miniMap.title: Mini Map
miniMap.description: Enable the inline mini map message navigator with branch previews. When disabled, a simpler Top/Bottom navigator is used.

security.title: Security
security.subtitle: Configure security settings for the application

webSecurity.title: Disable Web Security
webSecurity.description: This may help you resolve some CORS related issue. However, this is not recommended and may expose your application to security risks. Disable it only if you know what you are doing. You must restart the app for this setting to take effect.

remoteToolsConnector.description: Allow Msty Studio web to connect to this device to run remote tools and access local models. This service must be actively running to allow remote connections.

connectionToken.title: Connection Token
connectionToken.description: This token is used to authenticate the connection between Msty Studio and this app when connecting remotely. You can regenerate it at any time to invalidate the previous token. Make sure to use a strong token and keep it secret.

errorMessage.detail: Failed to enable Remote Service. Please check the logs for more details

notInstalled.description: Set up @:localAIService to run AI models locally on your device.

modelsLocation.title: Models Location
modelsLocation.description: Configure where your Local AI models are stored.

existingModels.title: Use Existing Models
existingModels.description: Use models you already have without downloading them again.

serviceConfigurations.title: @:service Configurations
serviceConfigurations.description: These configurations are applied to the @:localAIService when it starts. @:localAIService will automatically restart after you save any changes.

configurePortNumber.title: Configure Port Number
configurePortNumber.description: Port number for @:localAIService{'.'} Leave empty to use default.

maximumParallelChats.title: Maximum Parallel Chats
maximumParallelChats.description: Maximum number of concurrent chat sessions (when using split mode).

maximumLoadedModels.title: Maximum Loaded Models
maximumLoadedModels.description: Maximum number of LLMs loaded at the same time. Keeping more models in memory speeds up initial responses but uses more system resources.

enableNetworkAccess.title: Enable Network Access
enableNetworkAccess.description: Allow other devices on your network to access this @:localAIService through this deviceâ€™s IP address.

allowedNetworkOrigins.title: Allowed Network Origins
allowedNetworkOrigins.description: List permitted network origins here (comma-separated). Each entry must begin with http:// or https://. Use * to permit all origins.

allowMstyStudioAccess.title: Allow Access from Msty Studio
allowMstyStudioAccess.description: Allow connections from Msty Studio Web to this app so it can access @:localAIService{'.'}

captureServiceLogs.title: Capture @:service Logs
captureServiceLogs.description: Enable logging to capture service data for debugging. Use this option only when necessary.

advancedConfiguration.description: Enter valid JSON to set environment variables for the @:localAIService{'.'}

unsavedChanges.message: You have unsaved changes in the @:localAIService Configurations. Once you save, @:localAIService will be restarted with the new configurations.

errorMessage.detail: Failed to save @:localAIService Configurations. Please check the logs for more details.

modelConfigurations.title: @:model Configurations
modelConfigurations.description: These configurations get applied to all models during chat sessions.

keepAliveTimeout.title: Model Keep-Alive Timeout
keepAliveTimeout.description: Time (in minutes) after which the model will be unloaded from memory if not used.

advancedConfiguration.description: Enter valid JSON to pass extra parameters to models during chat sessions.

unsavedChanges.message: You have unsaved changes in the @:settings.localAI.modelConfigurations.title{'.'} Make sure to save them before starting a new chat session.

errorMessage.detail: Failed to save @:settings.localAI.modelConfigurations.title. Please check the logs for more details.

jinaAPIKeyForm.newDescription: Add a new Jina API key to use with the Jina Reader and Search endpoints. You can add multiple keys and verify them to ensure they are valid. When using the keys, Msty will pick a random valid key to use for the request.

toolbox.title: Toolbox
toolbox.toolsUsageWillSkip: Msty @:remoteToolsConnector.title is not running; tools usage will be skipped.

tools.title: Tool | Tools
tools.description: A collection of tools to help you with your LLM work.
tools.missingThisDependency: This dependency seems to be missing from your environment. Without this, the tool may not work as expected.

defaultParamsForm.description: These parameters will be used globally for all instances of {toolName} tool. You can override these when creating a toolset.

args.label: Arguments
args.description: @:select an @:argument and set its value. Leave it blank to skip setting a value.

customArg.label: Custom @:argument
customArg.description: Enter the name of the new @:argument{'.'} Separate multiple arguments with a comma.

env.label: Environment Variables
env.description: @:select or enter a new Environment @:variable and set its value.

addNewTool.title: Add New Tool
addNewTool.description: Add your own MCP compatible tool to the toolbox. Once added, you can add it to a toolset, set parameters, and use it with a model.
addNewTool.namePlaceholder: Give it a name (uses the tool ID by default)

id.label: Tool ID
id.placeholder: Unique tool identifier (auto-filled if detected from config)

addNewTool.duplicateId: Tool with this ID already exists. Please enter a unique ID.

successMessage.detail: Tool added to the toolbox. You can now add it to a toolset and use it with a model.

successMessageWithToolset.detail: Tool added to the toolbox and a matching toolset was created. It's ready to use with a model.

errorMessage.detail: Failed to add tool to the toolbox. {error}

toolConfig.label: Tool Configuration
toolConfig.placeholder: Enter or paste tool configuration JSON. Accepts direct config or wrapped formats (will auto-extract toolId)
toolConfig.showExampleTitle: Show me an example of a tool configuration
toolConfig.explanation: The tool configuration accepts multiple formats including wrapped configs with mcpServers. It will auto-extract the toolId and name when possible. Must contain at minimum {command}. Dynamic arguments need to be wrapped in curly braces {curly} like so: {argExample}. Similarly, dynamic environment variables can be set using {envVarLabel}.

editTool.title: Edit Tool
editTool.description: Update the name, notes, and configuration of the tool.

emptyPlaceholder.description1: Use external MCP tools powered by Msty @:remoteToolsConnector.title to extend your models' capabilities and enhance your LLM experience.
emptyPlaceholder.description2: You can get started by importing many of the tools that Msty ships with or adding your own tools.
emptyPlaceholder.description3: Note: These tools are not provided, tested, or maintained by Msty. We are merely providing a platform to use these and allowing to import them as a convenience. PLEASE USE THEM AT YOUR OWN RISK. Msty is not responsible for any issues that may arise from using these tools. Also, for support, please reach out to the tool's author.

successMessage.detail: {count} default tools imported successfully. You can create toolsets and use them with a model.

successMessageWithToolsets.detail: {count} default tools imported successfully and {toolsetCount} corresponding toolsets auto-created.

deleteConfirmation.description: Are you sure you want to delete {toolName}?

deleteAll.confirmationMessage: Are you sure you want to delete all tools? This action cannot be undone.
deleteAll.successMessage: All tools have been deleted successfully

noToolCalls.title: No Tool Calls Found
noToolCalls.description: It seems there were some tools being able to the model but it did not make any tool calls. This could be because the model did not need to use any tools.

toolsets.title: Toolset | Toolsets

emptyPlaceholder.title: No Toolsets found
emptyPlaceholder.description: Toolsets are a collection of tools with parameters. You can create a toolset and add tools to it. When chatting with a model, you can select one or multiple toolsets to use with the model.

toolsets.addSomeTools: Please add some tools to get started.

addNewToolset.title: Add New @:toolbox.toolsets.title
addNewToolset.description: Create a new toolset to group tools together. You can add tools to the toolset and use it with a model. Make sure to set/overwrite the parameters for each tool in the toolset by clicking {icon} button.

setParams.title: Set Parameters for {toolName}
setParams.description: Set parameters for the {toolName} tool. You can override the default parameters set for the tool.

modelMatchmaker.title: Model Matchmaker
modelMatchmaker.description: @:modelMatchmaker.title helps you find the perfect AI model for any task. Simply adjust the @:modelMatchmaker.gravity for the strengths you need (like coding, reasoning, or math) and Msty will intelligently rank and recommend the best models from our curated list based on your unique requirements. Keep in mind that there are various factors that can affect the performance of a model, such as the quality of the data it was trained on, the @.lower:size of the model, and the complexity of the task.

rankedModels.title: Ranked Models
rankedModels.emptyMessage: No models found. Try adjusting your requirements.

ca.title: Coding
ca.description: The ability to write code in a programming language.

aca.title: Agentic Coding
aca.description: The agentic ability to write code in a programming language.

daa.title: @:data Analysis
daa.description: The ability to analyze data and generate insights.

ifa.title: Instructions Following
ifa.description: The ability to follow instructions and perform tasks.

jak.title: GOAT: Generalist of All Trades
jak.description: The ability to perform a wide range of tasks.

la.title: Language
la.description: The ability to understand and generate human language.

ma.title: Mathematics
ma.description: The ability to perform mathematical calculations.

pp.title: Paraphrasing
pp.description: Demonstrated rewriting ability to rephrase any given text.

ra.title: Reasoning
ra.description: Critical Thinking - the ability to reason and make decisions.

sim.title: Simplification
sim.description: The ability to simplify any given complex text.

stg.title: Story Generation
stg.description: The ability to generate stories or narratives.

sum.title: Summarization
sum.description: The ability of summarizing textual and numerical information.

tu.title: Tools Usage
tu.description: The ability to call and use external tools.

mit.title: Max Input Tokens
mit.description: The max no. of tokens accepted in one call.

mot.title: Max Output Tokens
mot.description: The max no. of tokens generated in one call.

ics.title: Input Tokens Savings
ics.description: The cost savings of generating input tokens.

ocs.title: Output Tokens Savings
ocs.description: The cost savings of generating output tokens.

modelSquad.title: Model Squad
modelSquad.description: @:modelSquad.title is a collection of specialized AI models, where each models is assigned to perform a specific task, such as Auto Title Generation, @:context Summary Generation, etc. When it's time to perform that specific task, the assigned model is selected automatically.

dialog.description: Select a model to assign to the {task} task in ModelSquad.
dialog.helpText: This model will be used automatically when the {task} task is performed.

example.description: This component demonstrates how to register and use keyboard shortcuts in your components.
example.noActionsYet: No actions yet. Try pressing the shortcuts!

developerNotes.title: Developer Notes:
items: Shortcuts are automatically cleaned up when the component unmounts
Use component-scoped shortcuts to avoid ID conflicts
Platform-specific bindings are handled automatically (Cmd on Mac, Ctrl on Windows)
Check for conflicts before registering shortcuts that might collide with existing ones
Shortcuts can be global (work everywhere) or context-specific

chunksConsole.title: @:knowledgeStack.chunksConsole.chunks Console
chunksConsole.description: Use this console to understand how your Knowledge Stack, { title }, is being used and what chunks are being sent to a model when chatting. You can also delete a chunk if you think it's not relevant or useful.
chunksConsole.noResultsFound: No search results found. Try adjusting your query or search settings.
chunksConsole.noResultsAfterFilter: No results match the current similarity filter. Try adjusting the filter to show more results.
chunksConsole.filterDisclaimer: This filter only affects which results are displayed below. It does not change the actual query.

files.title: @:files
files.description: Add .pdf, .csv, .md, .json, .jsonl, .xlsx, .docx, .rtf, .txt, .pptx or any other supported file types.

folders.description: Add folders containing files. You can drop Obsidian Vaults as well.

folders.fileIgnored: This file is ignored based on .mstyignore or .gitignore rules

notes.empty: No notes added yet. Click 'Add Note' to get started.

youTubeLinks.title: YouTube Links
youTubeLinks.description: Add YouTube video links to index their transcripts. Msty will fetch transcripts and make them searchable.
youTubeLinks.dropZoneText: Drag and drop YouTube links here or paste them below
youTubeLinks.inputPlaceholder: Paste YouTube URLs here (space or comma separated)...
youTubeLinks.inputPlaceholderWithDetected: Paste YouTube URLs here ({count} detected) | Paste YouTube URLs here ({count} detected)
youTubeLinks.detectedUnpulledUrls: {count} YouTube URL detected but not pulled yet | {count} YouTube URLs detected but not pulled yet

loadMode.title: Load Mode
loadMode.dialogDescription: Choose how this file should be loaded during Knowledge Stack composition.

static.label: Static Mode
static.description: Uses the cached version from when the file was added. Fast and predictable, but doesn't reflect recent changes.
static.shortDescription: Cached content loaded from initial indexing

dynamic.label: Dynamic Mode
dynamic.description: Loads the latest file content on each composition. Slightly slower but always up-to-date.
dynamic.shortDescription: Fresh content loaded on each composition

sync.label: Sync Mode
sync.description: Watches for file changes and automatically recomposes. Best for small, frequently updated files.

syncMode.startFailedDetail: Please ensure the Knowledge Stack has files marked for Sync Mode
syncMode.allPausedDetail: File watching has been stopped for all knowledge stacks

analytics.title: Analytics and Insights
analytics.noAnalyticsDescription: Analytics will be available after composing this Knowledge Stack.
analytics.noSectionsSelectedDescription: Please select one or more analytics sections above to view insights about your Knowledge Stack.
analytics.ignoredItemsDescription: These items are excluded from search and retrieval operations
analytics.allItemsIncluded: All items in this Knowledge Stack are included in search and retrieval

piiScrubbing.title: PII Scrubbing
piiScrubbing.failedToLoadAnalytics: Failed to load PII analytics data
piiScrubbing.clickToViewAnalytics: Click "Load Analytics" to view PII scrubbing statistics
piiScrubbing.scoreTooltip: This score reflects how comprehensively PII scrubbing is applied to your Knowledge Stack. A higher score means more chunks have been processed for PII removal.
piiScrubbing.optionalDescription: PII scrubbing is optional. Enable it in query settings only if your content contains sensitive personal information.
piiScrubbing.protectionDescription: Measures how well sensitive information is protected in your Knowledge Stack

insights.excellentPrivacy: Excellent privacy protection - nearly all content secured
insights.goodPrivacy: Good privacy protection - most content is secured
insights.partialPrivacy: Partial privacy protection - consider reviewing settings
insights.limitedPrivacy: Limited privacy protection - review sensitive content
insights.notEnabled: PII scrubbing is not enabled. This is completely fine if your content doesn't contain sensitive personal information.
insights.whenToEnable: Consider enabling PII scrubbing only if your Knowledge Stack contains names, addresses, phone numbers, emails, or other personal data.
insights.significantReduction: Significant content reduction ({percentage}%) - extensive PII found
insights.moderateReduction: Moderate content reduction ({percentage}%) - some PII removed
insights.minimalReduction: Minimal content reduction ({percentage}%) - low PII detected
insights.noContentChange: No content size change - no PII detected or removed
insights.mostProcessed: Most chunks processed - some may need attention
insights.incompleteProcessing: Incomplete processing - check PII scrubbing configuration
insights.largeKnowledgeBase: Large knowledge base - consider increasing PII detection coverage
insights.manyUnprocessed: Many unprocessed chunks - review PII scrubbing settings
insights.optionalFeature: PII scrubbing is optional. Enable it in query settings if your content contains sensitive information like names, emails, or phone numbers.
insights.privacyOption: PII scrubbing helps protect sensitive information. It's optional and can be enabled in query settings if needed.

analytics.highSkipRates: {count} content type(s) have high skip rates
analytics.singleContentType: Single content type - consider diversifying sources
analytics.excellentDiversity: Excellent content diversity across multiple source types
analytics.reduceChunkSize: Reduce chunk size to 800-1200 characters for better content granularity
analytics.increaseChunkSize: Increase chunk size to 1500-2000 characters for better efficiency
analytics.balancedSearch: Balanced approach combining keyword + semantic search
analytics.semanticSearch: AI-powered semantic search - best for conceptual queries
analytics.keywordSearch: Traditional keyword search - best for exact terms
analytics.lowChunkCount: Very low chunk count may miss relevant information
analytics.highChunkCount: High chunk count may include noise and slow responses
analytics.optimalChunkCount: Optimal chunk count for balanced retrieval
analytics.relaxedFiltering: Relaxed filtering - may include loosely related content
analytics.customPromptPrefix: Custom prompt prefix will guide query interpretation
analytics.mostItemsLocked: Most items are locked - limited reprocessing capability
analytics.privacyProtectionEnabled: Privacy protection enabled for sensitive data
analytics.noPiiScrubbing: No PII scrubbing - ensure content is not sensitive
analytics.largeKnowledgeBase: Large knowledge base - increase chunk count for better coverage
analytics.smallKnowledgeBase: Small knowledge base - consider reducing chunk count
analytics.lockedItemsPercentage: {percentage}% of items are locked and won't be reprocessed
analytics.unlockRecommendation: Consider unlocking temporarily locked items if they need updates
analytics.overHalfLocked: Over 50% of items are locked. This may significantly reduce the knowledge base's ability to stay updated.

loadMode.title: Load Mode Analytics
loadMode.description: File loading behavior across your Knowledge Stack
loadMode.noFiles: No files in this Knowledge Stack
loadMode.desktopOnly: Load Mode options are only available in the desktop application
loadMode.notAvailable: Load Mode options are only available in the desktop application
loadMode.noSpecialModes: All files are using Static Mode. Enable Dynamic or Sync Mode for files to use the latest content.
loadMode.staticDescription: Cached content loaded from initial indexing
loadMode.dynamicDescription: Fresh content loaded on each composition

highSyncCount.title: High Sync File Count
highSyncCount.recommendation: Consider using Dynamic Mode for less frequently updated files to reduce resource usage

syncEnabled.title: Sync Mode Enabled
syncEnabled.description: {count} files are automatically updating when changed

highDynamicUsage.title: High Dynamic Mode Usage
highDynamicUsage.description: {percentage}% of files are using Dynamic Mode
highDynamicUsage.recommendation: Static Mode may be sufficient for files that rarely change

dynamicEnabled.title: Dynamic Mode Active
dynamicEnabled.description: {count} files are loading fresh content on each composition

staticOnly.title: Static Mode Only
staticOnly.description: All files are using cached content from initial indexing
staticOnly.recommendation: Enable Dynamic or Sync Mode for frequently updated files to ensure fresh content

mixedModes.title: Mixed Load Modes
mixedModes.description: {percentage}% of files are using special load modes

embeddingModel.title: Embedding Model
embeddingModel.warning: Changing the embedding model will require recomposing the entire Knowledge Stack and even then there is a chance that recomposition will fail.
embeddingModel.learnMore: Learn more about embedding model compatibility

chunkingMethod.title: Chunking Method
chunkingMethod.description: Choose how documents should be chunked into smaller pieces for better search and retrieval.

overlapping.title: Overlapping
overlapping.description: Choose how much overlap should be between chunks. Higher overlap can improve context but increase token usage.

chunkSize.title: @:knowledgeStack.chunksConsole.chunk Size
chunkSize.description: Set the maximum size of each chunk in characters. Smaller chunks can improve search accuracy but increase token usage.

chunkSizesToIgnore.title: @:knowledgeStack.chunksConsole.chunk Sizes To Ignore
chunkSizesToIgnore.description: Specify chunk sizes that should be ignored during processing. Useful for excluding very small or very large chunks.

chunks.title: Knowledge Stack Context
chunks.loadError: Failed to load Knowledge Stack chunks. Please try again.

retrievalMode.title: @:knowledgeStack.chunksConsole.chunk Retrieval Mode
retrievalMode.description: Choose between Push mode where chunks are pre-fetched, or Pull Mode where the model can query Knowledge Stacks directly

chunks.loadError: Failed to load Knowledge Stack chunks. Please try again.

tooltip.scrubbed: Content has been scrubbed for PII removal

chunksVisualizer.title: @:knowledgeStack.chunksConsole.chunks Visualizer
chunksVisualizer.selectFileDescription: Choose a file from the left to visualize its chunks and content
chunksVisualizer.overlapRemoved: Overlaps have been removed for clean text reconstruction
chunksVisualizer.overlapWithPrevious: This text overlaps with the previous chunk
chunksVisualizer.overlapWithNext: This text overlaps with the next chunk

tooltip.scrubbed: Content has been scrubbed for PII removal

chunksVisualizer.selectItemDescription: Choose a file or note from the left to visualize its chunks and content
chunksVisualizer.confirmDeleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete {count} selected chunks? This action cannot be undone.
